newsitem.title: UK: Halifax sends out share allocation details.
newsitem.headline: Halifax sends out share allocation details.

text.p: The Halifax Building Society said on Tuesday it has begun to send out details of individual share allocations for its June 2 stock market flotation.
Borrowing and saving members who qualify will have to complete and return a share claim form by May 26 in order to receive their entitlement.
Halifax is offering a new special share account for shareholders to keep their shares in and is also offering facilities for the sale of shares.
Halifax said it will sell free shares sold by members to financial institutions in a real price auction for which it will perform a bookbuilding operation in the run up to the conversion.
The Halifax will publish a price in the press on April 28 which will form the minimum that shareholders will receive and the shares will not be sold unless this price can be achieved.
It will hold further auctions if necessary for shares tendered for sale by members after May 26.
In all cases, members will receive the weighted average of the price bid by institutions.
